member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.SiteSync.SiteSyncResources.WhenDoYouNeedSynchronization
member.summary: phrase: When do you need synchronization...
member.value:
When do you need synchronization?
You need synchronization if you want to have several stages (servers/sites) for your data
e.g. 1 Work; 2 Test; 3 Production (live)
Or you can use it to simply transfer your structure and data to another server. For example, you can migrate all data from your site to existing Multisite instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.SiteSync.SiteSyncResources.ConfigSnapInSyncEnabledDescription
member.summary: phrase: Controls whether the option to promote basic and advanced settings to the destination environment will be visible on the SiteSync module screen. This option works optimally with configuration storage modes FileSystem or Database. Config storage mode Auto is also supported when you are not using Continuous delivery. If you are using continuous delivery this option should be disabled and config changes should be handled via config transformations and deployment.
member.value: Controls whether the option to promote basic and advanced settings to the destination environment will be visible on the SiteSync module screen. This option works optimally with configuration storage modes FileSystem or Database. Config storage mode Auto is also supported when you are not using Continuous delivery. If you are using continuous delivery this option should be disabled and config changes should be handled via config transformations and deployment.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.SiteSync.SiteSyncResources.PublishingSnapInSyncEnabledDescription
member.summary: label: Controls whether the option to promote search indexes to the destination environment visible on the SiteSync module screen. If this option is enabled SiteSync will promote the search index definition and run a reindex operation on the destination environment to generate the search index files.
member.value: Controls whether the option to promote search indexes to the destination environment visible on the SiteSync module screen.
